link.title: Eastwood Elementary School - News

form.name: aspnetForm

ul.li: Better today than we were yesterday. Better tomorrow than we are today.
Creating strong independent adults who are ready to meet the challenges of the 21st century.

p.img: A drive-by to say "hi" to Eastwood teachers and staff! The parade will be on Wednesday May 6th from 6:30-7:00 on campus. Cars will enter the campus via the bus loop in front of Eastwood Elementary on Sugar Ridge Road and wind through to drive past the middle school, high school, and then exiting out on Luckey Rd. Cars will NOT be able to stop along the way so that we maintain social distancing and a continuous flow of vehicles.

div.a: Eastwood Elementary We Miss You Video

span.p: Mrs. Rebecca Perkins, Eastwood Speech Pathologist, compiled pictures and messages from Eastwood Elementary staff to let the students know how much they are missed!

p.a: View the We Miss You! video.

span.p: Community updates & announcements are sent out via email by Superintendent Brent Welker and can be found on the Superintendent Email Update page.

p.strong: If you would like to sign up to receive Mr. Welker's Community Updates via email,

span.p: Please complete the transportation form if your child(ren) will be riding the bus for the 2020-2021 school year.

span.div: The video below was created for Take a Walk Tuesday as part of our online spirit week, #EastwoodSpiritWeek. Enjoy, you will see many familiar faces in this video. We do miss seeing everyone on a daily basis. Hope to see you soon!

div.a: New Eastwood Elementary School Counseling Website

span.p: The New Eastwood Elementary School Counseling Website includes a Google Form to contact Mrs. Asmus, resources, videos, and activities to keep kids learning about social emotional topics. Might as well make their screen time productive!
Click the link below to access Kindergarten lessons.

Packets will be available for pick up on April 6th, 4:30pm - 6:30pm at the elementary. Enter the Elementary parking lot just as you would for child drop off/pickup. There will be five stations set up, one for each K teacher. Please STAY IN YOUR CAR and the teachers will place the learning binder in your trunk.
Please view the registration flyer for details.

Eastwood Schools will provide Kindergarten Screening for the 2020-2021 school year. Screening dates will be May 14 & 15, 2020. Please complete the sign up form and return it to the address found on the bottom of the sign up form. For more information please view the Kindergarten Screening info sheet.

p.img: A reminder that Eastwood will replace the Instant Alert system with Ohio Alerts to inform parents of closings, delays and other important information. Please refer to the Ohio Alert Sign Up parent letter for details.

img.style: width: 75px; float: left; margin-left: 5px; margin-right: 5px; height: 105px;

div.a: Doe v. Ohio Department of Education Class Action Notice

span.p: The parties in the Doe v. Ohio Department of Education class action have submitted a proposed settlement to the U.S. District Court for approval. The first step in the approval process of the settlement is to provide notice of the proposed settlement to affected students and their parents. Please refer to the Doe v. Ohio Department of Education Notice for details.
